name: precipitancy
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the quality or action of doing something sooner or faster than expected, and without enough thought or preparation: Many people were critical of his precipitancy in forcing them to make a decision. Matters were taken out of his control by the precipitance of local commanders.
More examplesFewer examplesDemocratic governments work under the natural restraints of public opinion, which forces them to act without unnecessary precipitancy.He expressed his dismay at the precipitancy with which this change had been introduced.
